generif.text: Calmodulin regulates Ca(2+)-dependent feedback inhibition of store-operated Ca(2+) influx by interaction with a site in the C terminus of TrpC1.

Store-operated calcium entry (SOCE), a unique plasma membrane Ca(2+) entry mechanism, is activated when ER-[Ca(2+)] is decreased. SOCE is mediated via the primary channel, Orai1, as well as others such as TRPC1.
TRPC1/Orai1 may form a complex that mediates Ca(2+) influx and nitric oxide production via activating store-operated calcium channel and receptor-operated calcium channel activation.

Study reports a novel mechanism of self-limiting activation of TRPC1/4 and TRPC1/5 channels by G protein-coupled receptor stimulation. Galphaq protein directly interacts with either TRPC4 or TRPC5 of the heterotetrameric channels to permit activation. Simultaneously, Galphaq-coupled PLCbeta activation leads to the breakdown of PI(4,5)P2, which inhibits activity of TRPC1/4 and 1/5 channels.

wikipathways.name: Cell-type Dependent Selectivity of CCK2R Signaling

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a membrane protein that can form a non-selective channel permeable to calcium and other cations. The encoded protein appears to be induced to form channels by a receptor tyrosine kinase-activated phosphatidylinositol second messenger system and also by depletion of intracellular calcium stores. Two transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been found for this gene. [provided by RefSeq, Oct 2011].
